pages.text: Pseudotherium argentinus (whose name means "Almost-but-not a Mammal, from Argentina") was a species of mammaliaform cynodont that lived during the Late Triassic in what is now the famous Ischigualasto Formation of Argentina. It sported a prominent saggital crest running along the top of its skull, anchoring large jaw muscles that likely gave it a powerful bite. Its canine teeth are thin and curved, with unique ridges on either side running down their length.
